articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Scientists discover microbe that could stop malaria transmission - Aljazeera.com
articles.description: A new study shows that the Microsporidia MB microbe blocks malaria parasites from spreading in mosquitoes.
articles.content:
Scientists have discovered a new microbe that protects mosquitoes from being infected by malaria, a finding that could be a significant breakthrough in the fight against the spread of the disease, which is spread to humans through mosquito bites.

articles.description: The leading infectious disease expert on the White House coronavirus task force also said he was "very sensitive" to the economic impact of COVID-19.
articles.content:

articles.title: The response to Covid-19 is critical. It's also making clinical trials harder - STAT
articles.description: When health officials succeed in stamping out outbreaks, they also make it more difficult to find the volunteers needed for clinical trials.
articles.content: In March, a team of Chinese scientists studying whether the antiviral remdesivir was effective against Covid-19 ran into a problem. Stringent public health measures used in Wuhan led to marked reductions in new patient presentations, the researchers wrote. Wi… [+9735 chars]

articles.author: Staff Reporter
articles.title: Italian Scientists Claim the World's First COVID-19 Vaccine That Can Neutralize Coronavirus in Human Cell - Science Times
articles.description: According to the tests carried out at Rome's infectious-disease Spallanzani Hospital, an Italian coronavirus vaccine has antibodies generated in mice that work on human cells.
